alert.note: Alert for Estill; Jackson; Lee; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Owsley, southern Estill, northern Jackson and western Lee Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kerby Knob, or 10 miles northwest of McKee, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Brazil, Locust Branch and Waneta around 625 PM EDT. Alcorn, Jinks and Foxtown around 630 PM EDT. Blanton Flats, Witt, Wisemantown and Macedonia around 635 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Drip Rock, Alumbaugh, Wagersville, Wind Cave, Lakes, Station Camp, South Irvine, New Zion, Ravenna, Leighton, Evelyn, Shade, Old Orchard, Texola, Arvel, Willow Shoals, Pryse and Pinnacle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern and east central Kentucky.
